sense.name: Tilt or slant to one side; change the angle or physical arrangement of.
sense.examples: He cocked his cap at a jaunty angle. He stood up and cocked his head to the side. The puppy cocked its ears up and stared.

sense.name: Set the trigger of a firearm back for firing.
sense.examples: He cocked the gun and waited. You have to release the safety in order to cock the rifle. Lock and load and then cock the sucker!

sense.name: Walk with a proud gait, often in an attempt to impress others.
sense.examples: He cocks around like a rooster in a hen house. She really cocks around the lab as if she owned the place.
